nodes.name: getParentAndBlockhash
reCalculateBlockheaders

constructor.details: cannot be deployed in a genesis block

getParentAndBlockhash(bytes).return: the parent blockhash and the keccak256 of the provided blockheader (= the corresponding blockhash)

params._bHash: blockhash of the 1st element of the _blockheaders-array
params._blockNumber: blocknumber of the 1st element of the _blockheaders-array. This is only needed to verify the blockheader
params._blockheaders: array with serialized blockheaders in reverse order, i.e. from youngest to oldest

reCalculateBlockheaders(bytes[],bytes32,.return: 0x0 if the functions detects a wrong chaining of blocks, blockhash of the last element of the array otherwhise

recreateBlockheaders(uint256,bytes[]).details: reverts when there is not parent block already stored in the contractreverts when the chain of headers is incorrectfunction is public due to the usage of a dynamic bytes array (not yet supported for external functions)

params._blockNumber: the block number to start recreation from
params._blockheaders: array with serialized blockheaders in reverse order (youngest -> oldest) => (e.g. 100, 99, 98)

saveBlockNumber(uint256).details: reverts if the block can't be found inside the evm

params._numBlocks: the number of blocks to search for

searchForAvailableBlock(uint256,uint256).return: the closes snapshot of found within the given range, 0 else

methods.constructor: constructor, calls snapshot-function when contract get deployed as entry point

getParentAndBlockhash(bytes).notice: returns the blockhash and the parent blockhash from the provided blockheader

getRlpUint(bytes,uint256).notice: returns the value from rlp encoded data.         This function is limited to only value up to 32 bytes length!

reCalculateBlockheaders(bytes[],bytes32,.notice: starts with a given blockhash and its header and tries to recreate a (reverse) chain of blocksthe array of the blockheaders have to be in reverse order (e.g. [100,99,98,97])

recreateBlockheaders(uint256,bytes[]).notice: starts with a given blocknumber and its header and tries to recreate a (reverse) chain of blocksonly usable when the given blocknumber is already in the smart contractit will be checked whether the provided chain is correct by using the reCalculateBlockheaders functionif successfull the last blockhash of the header will be added to the smart contract

saveBlockNumber(uint256).notice: stores a certain blockhash to the state

searchForAvailableBlock(uint256,uint256).notice: searches for an already existing snapshot

snapshot().notice: stores the currentBlock-1 in the smart contract
